New Records: Carlos Rodon allowed just one run and three hits, striking out nine and walking none in six innings.
He had the most swings and misses by a Yankee pitcher in a postseason game since 2008.
Key Match Events: Rodon dominated the Guardians with a mix of fastball and slider, striking out nine batters, including seven with sliders.
The Yankees scored four runs during Rodon's streak of 11 straight outs.
Brayan Rocchio hit a solo homer in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees believed in Rodon's potential despite his inconsistent past performances.
Rodon's previous postseason struggles, including a 4.37 ERA in three appearances, were noted before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised Rodon's command and focus, calling it a dominant performance.
Rodon reflected on his calm demeanor, attributing it to lessons learned from Gerrit Cole.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a chilly 50-degree night.
Rodon's performance was noted as a pivotal moment in the Yankees' playoff push.
Others: The Yankees' offense was supported by homers from Giancarlo Stanton and Juan Soto.
Rodon's slider was a key weapon, with 13 swings and 9 misses against Cleveland hitters.
